revised_title: Tectonic Settings of Regional Metamorphism in the Yalu Tsangpo Suture Zone, Tibet
tldr: This article examines the tectonic, deformation, and metamorphic history of the Yalu Tsangpo suture zone in southern Tibet, a region where the Indian and Eurasian tectonic plates collided. The study focuses on the three tectonic units present in the area and their respective geological evolutions. The findings provide insights into the processes that led to the thickening of the continental crust and the implications for understanding ancient continental collision orogens.
